Text: Could you post some more details? A lot of releases have really bad encoding settings, such as unnessarily using ref>5 (breaking dxva compatiblity with minimal to no quality gain), or level 4.1 (if you look at the max bitrate, they are in fact level 3.1 compliant, just the wrong header), etc

Ok. It's ref=12. Another waste of time.
What a shame as it's otherwise quite good!

Why not set ref=4 or 5 and lose maybe less than 0.5% of quality and get Level 3.1 compliance not to mention faster encoding.

If you want quality that bad why not set subme=8, which should be more than enough to compensate the quality loss, if any exists that is.
Thank's, it works great :D I have been seeding... This is a awesome movie and i hope it stays alive.
